item.title: Ticket #3394 (Possible bug in update_option()) updated
item.dc:creator: roscohead
item.description: Version changed

item.title: Ticket #3394 (Possible bug in update_option()) created
item.dc:creator: roscohead
item.description:
I posted this on the forum, and someone kindly pointed me here :)

I think I've hit a bug in the update_option() function. The problem occurs when the $newvalue is an array containing arrays - it checks 

	// If the new and old values are the same, no need to update.
	$oldvalue = get_option($option_name);
	if ( $newvalue == $oldvalue ) {
		return false;
	}

to see if the value has changed. However this behaves incorrectly when the only change is in the order of elements of the sub-array, the comparison returns true, so the setting is never updated.

My workaround is to do a comparison on the serialized versions instead: 

	// If the new and old values are the same, no need to update.
	$oldvalue = get_option($option_name);
	if ( maybe_serialize($newvalue) == maybe_serialize($oldvalue) ) {
		return false;
	}

This seems to work, and doesn't seem to break anything, but it has only been minimally tested. If there's a better way to fix the problem, feel free to ignore my suggested fix :)

ROSCO

item.title: Ticket #3290 (Importer strips img class and style) updated
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description: I think the real problem is that wp-admin/admin.php calls kses_init_filters() for *every* import, even for those with admin permissions, and there's no easy way--that I've yet found--for a plugin to disable it.

item.title: Ticket #3391 (Can't click Labels for Radio Buttons in Moderation Queue) created
item.dc:creator: JeremyVisser
item.description:
In WordPress 2.0.5, with a comment in the moderation queue, go to WordPress Admin â†’ Manage â†’ Awaiting Moderation (x). Try clicking the labels for the radio buttons "Approve", "Spam", "Delete", "Defer until later". That does not work because the IDs and corresponding label elements do not match.

This problem has been fixed for /trunk/, but the 2.0 branch still has the problem. Attached is a patch to fix the problem.
